intro: Centropodia forskaolii subsp. forskaolii, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
